alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 25 at 5:54PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: .Heavy showers approaching from the east are continuing to develop as it bring heavy showers over Guam. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM CHST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Guam. * WHEN...Until 745 PM ChST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 549 PM ChST, The public reported heavy rain at Marine Corps Drive & Cross Island Road. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in Marine Corps Drive & Cross Island Road. - Marine Corps Drive & Cross Island Road is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of one and a half to two and a half inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dededo, Tamuning, Yigo, Mangilao, Chalan Pago-Ordot, Barrigada, Yona, Hagatna Heights, Andersen AFB, Talofofo, Mongmong-Toto-Maite, Sinajana, Inarajan, Asan, Merizo, Piti, Santa Rita and Umatac. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
